# Your turn

## Use an extension package

.pull-left[

1. Edit your YAML! Change the `output:` key to `distill::distill_article()` (note: this requires you to install the [`distill` package](https://rstudio.github.io/distill/) on your own computer)

1. `r emo::ji("yarn")` **Knit** to distill_article.
]

.pull-right[

```{r echo = FALSE}
library(ymlthis)
yml_empty() %>% 
  yml_author("Your name here") %>% 
  yml_title("Your title here") %>% 
  yml_output(distill::distill_article()) %>% 
  asis_yaml_output()
```
]

```{r echo = FALSE}
countdown(minutes = 2)
```

# Markdown tables

.pull-left[

```markdown
| Time          | Activity           |
|:--------------|:-------------------|
| 01:00 - 01:50 | Session 1          |
| 01:50 - 02:00 | *Break*            |
| 02:00 - 02:45 | Session 2          |
| 02:45 - 03:00 | *Break*            |
| 03:00 - 03:50 | Session 3          |
| 03:50 - 04:00 | *Break*            |
| 04:00 - 04:45 | Session 4          |
| 04:45 - 05:00 | Wrap-up / Overtime |
```
]

# Simple tables


.pull-left[
`knitr::kable()`

it knows format automatically

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
mock_surv <- read_csv(here::here("static/mockpaper/data/mockdata.csv")) %>%
  mutate(fu_fct = fct_recode(as.factor(fu_stat), 
                             "Lived" = "1", "Died" = "2")) %>% 
  filter(fu_fct == "Lived")
ggplot(mock_surv, aes(x = age, y = fu_time)) + geom_point() +geom_smooth(method = "lm")

ggplot(mock_surv, aes(x = hgb, y = fu_time)) + geom_point() +geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```
